attributes.comment:
As a family in the process of adopting from China, we are very disheartened and
disappointed to hear of the possible increase in USCIS fees for adoption related
applications/forms. With the wait for referral from China moving from 6-8 months
to over 18 months, we have already had to redo our fingerprints once and our
I600A, so we have already had to pay double the initial fee. Adoption is already an
expensive endeavor and increasing the fees on the U.S. side of things is a
deterent to families looking to adopt especially if they may have to renew these
forms and fingerprints due to the long wait.

If you are seriously considering this increase, please consider extending the
approval period once these forms are approved. 15 months for fingerprints and 18
months for I171H is too short especially if families have to reapply due to a longer
process/wait.

On behalf of the thousands of families who adopt internationally every year, we
would like to formally express our opposition to this increase in fees for adoption
related documents. Please do not raise these fees.

Sincerely,

Mr & Mrs Mathison
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
